newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan Asustek in US$235.8M GDR issue.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan Asustek in US$235.8M GDR issue.

text.p: Motherboard giant Asustek Computer Inc said on Monday the total value of its global depository receipt issue in London on Friday was about US$235.8 million, making it the biggest GDR issue by a Taiwan firm.
"Our company on May 23...successfully issued an equivalent of 21 million shares in GDRs, raising some US$235.8 million," Asustek said in a statement.

Asustek -- nicknamed Taiwan's "king share" because its share price is the island's runaway highest at T$373 per share at Monday's close -- said the US$235.8 million raised would be put toward expanding its existing motherboard production and funding plans to produce notebook computers.
Asustek did not say when it might begin notebook manufacturing.
Asustek in 1996 posted a huge pre-tax profit of T$4.07 billion (US$146 million) on sales of T$13.33 billion (US$479 million).
